articles.headline: At Schwab, Unkept Promise To Investors
articles.snippet: Charles Schwab said his firm was “on the side of the investor,” but it obfuscated the risks of a losing fund. Even as it settles with the S.E.C., it is blaming others.
articles.abstract: Charles Schwab said his firm was “on the side of the investor,” but it obfuscated the risks of a losing fund. Even as it settles with the S.E.C., it is blaming others.
articles.lead_paragraph: Claiming to be holier than thou is not a prescription for winning friends among the thous. But it can be an effective marketing strategy in a business where public confidence is less than solid.

articles.headline: Tucson Pauses in Grief for the Youngest Victim
articles.snippet: The youngest victim of the Tucson shootings, Christina-Taylor Green, was buried amid an outpouring of grief.
articles.abstract: The youngest victim of the Tucson shootings, Christina-Taylor Green, was buried amid an outpouring of grief.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUCSON — The first funeral in the aftermath of Saturday’s shooting rampage might turn out to be the most heart-wrenching.
articles.byline: By Sam Dolnick and Marc Lacey

articles.headline: A Duane Reade in Brooklyn With a Beer Bar
articles.snippet: Adding the beer station was a way for the drug chain to soothe concerns that it would run a local pharmacy out of business.
articles.abstract: Adding the beer station was a way for the drug chain to soothe concerns that it would run a local pharmacy out of business.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Duane Reade opened a new store a few months ago in Brooklyn, it faced opposition from residents loyal to a local pharmacy. So it decided to include something in the store that the neighborhood did not have: a bar that specializes in beer.

articles.headline: Uncle Sam Wants His AAA Rating
articles.snippet: Moody’s and S.& P. warned the United States that it might ruin its triple-A credit rating if the national debt kept increasing.
articles.abstract: Moody’s and S.& P. warned the United States that it might ruin its triple-A credit rating if the national debt kept increasing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is Wall Street listening to the Tea Party?

articles.headline: Auditors See Rising Defaults in Rural Loans
articles.snippet: More than 10 percent of the stimulus-related loans might have gone to borrowers that were ineligible, a federal inspector general says.
articles.abstract: More than 10 percent of the stimulus-related loans might have gone to borrowers that were ineligible, a federal inspector general says.
articles.lead_paragraph: Seeking to buoy a strained rural economy in the midst of the recession, Congress ordered up a huge increase in federal mortgage guarantees for small-town home buyers as part of the 2009 economic stimulus package.

articles.headline: Accused Soldier in Brig as WikiLeaks Link Is Sought
articles.snippet: Supporters of Pfc. Bradley Manning, accused of leaking cables, are concerned that he is being treated unfairly.
articles.abstract: Supporters of Pfc. Bradley Manning, accused of leaking cables, are concerned that he is being treated unfairly.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Julian Assange, the flamboyant founder of WikiLeaks, is living on a supporter’s 600-acre estate outside London, where he has negotiated $1.7 million in book deals and regularly issues defiant statements about the antisecrecy group’s plans.

articles.headline: Banks Poised to Pay Dividends After 3-Year Gap
articles.snippet: The reversal marks a milestone as banks have repaired their balance sheets after the bailout.
articles.abstract: The reversal marks a milestone as banks have repaired their balance sheets after the bailout.
articles.lead_paragraph: Investors in bank stocks are about to get a big cut of the profits again.
articles.byline: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Eric Dash

articles.headline: A Clamor for Gun Limits, but Few Expect Real Changes
articles.snippet: Gun rights advocates said that there was little chance the attack would produce new legislation.
articles.abstract: Gun rights advocates said that there was little chance the attack would produce new legislation.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUCSON  The National Rifle Association has gone uncommonly dark since the weekend shootings here. A posting on its Web site expresses sympathies for the victims of the violence, and N.R.A. officials said they would have nothing to say until the funerals and memorial services were over.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Jennifer Steinhauer

articles.headline: Tunisia Leader Flees and Prime Minister Claims Power
articles.snippet: President Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali has left the country amid protests, diplomats say, and the prime minister went on state television to say he is in charge.
articles.abstract: President Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali has left the country amid protests, diplomats say, and the prime minister went on state television to say he is in charge.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUNIS  Tunisia’s president, Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali, fled his country on Friday night, capitulating after a month of mounting protests calling for an end to his 23 years of authoritarian rule. The official Saudi Arabian news agency said he arrived in the country early Saturday.
